TopicTitle: Simple idea that might just improve the game a lot - Pre-Launch Trajectory Planning

Articles.Content:
Hi,

I've been a video games tester (true tester working my life out of it not on my computer at home on open betas) for a while and i must say, this games is incredible. The simple fact that my computer can run it, combined with its relatively incredible stability for a game not yet officially released and the level of freedom of the game, all this makes for a grand title.

But even games as great as this one can be improved sligthly and I have a small idea of a feature that would make the whole game a lot better:

"Trajectory planning before take-off"

Basically, being able to tweak a predicted trajectory out of orbit with the estimated burn and all that you normally can only do in flight. This would help greatly achieve orbit with the most basic rockets at the beginning of the campaign but also WAY easier to reach a target efficiently. You could plan your take-off to reach a target directly instead of going approximately in the right direction and then, using a lot of fuel, adjust you vector. Also, it would make it easier to make contact between a craft and a refueling space station in orbit.

So this is y grain of salt on the only feature I thought was missing from the game thus far. And before anyone blasts me comment, this is a point of view and the game is already incredible but i think this small feature is technically easier than most to implement and would yield a very high "satisfaction from players" to "effort from Devs" ratio.

Clarifying thread title to include the nature of the suggestion

I've had a similar idea to this before. And Protractor and Kerbal Engineer should be stock features, not mods.

EDIT: Just to clarify - I agree

+1 I'd love to be able to launch directly into a Mun-intercept, or hell, an Eeloo intercept.

I'm not asking for the game to setup those encounters automagically, just for the ability to actually plan them out before launch!

I thought this was on the Official Planned Features List, but it seems "Create flight plans" is marked as citation needed. I do hope it is planned.

I imagine it might be an extension of the manoeuvre node system - ascent nodes or something to account for the continuous burn. Perhaps even accounting for TWR and atmospheric drag throughout flight.
